name: outline
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: outline
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the main shape or edge of something, without any details

example.eg: She drew the outline of the boat and then coloured it in.
example.egtrans: 她画了这只船的草图，然后给它着色。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: as a shape with an edge but without any details

example.eg: The mountain was visible only in outline as the light faded.
example.egtrans: 光线暗了下来，只能看见山的轮廓。

dsense.name: outline
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a description of the main facts about something

example.eg: If you read the minutes of the meeting, they'll give you a broad outline of what was discussed.
example.egtrans: 如果你看了会议记录，就会知道讨论的大概内容。

example.eg: Some novelists start by writing an outline (= plan of the main points of the story).
example.egtrans: 有些小说家创作时会先写个提纲。

name: outline
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: outline
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to draw the main shape or edge of something

example.eg: The area we're interested in is outlined in red on the map.
example.egtrans: 我们感兴趣的地区已经用红笔在地图上勾出来了。

dsense.name: outline
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give the main facts about something

example.eg: At the interview she outlined what I would be doing.
example.egtrans: 面试时她简要介绍了一下我将要从事的工作。
